wikipedia_page.main: Brigadier General Herbert William Studd  (26 December 1870 – 8 August 1947) was an English first-class cricketer and soldier.

response: Charles Palairet was descended from a Huguenot family called Palayret who had fled initially to the Netherlands, later to England, when Louis XIV revoked the Edict of Nantes in 1689.Neville, P. (23 September 2004). Palairet, Sir (Charles) Michael (1882–1956), diplomatist. Oxford Dictionary of National Biography. Retrieved 8 Dec. 2017, link He was a cousin of the cricketers Lionel Palairet and Richard Palairet. In 1915 he married Mary, daughter of Herbert Studd. Their daughter Anne married Julian Asquith, 2nd Earl of Oxford and Asquith.

response: At Eton, Cole was a pupil of Oscar Browning and continued to correspond with him throughout his career.65 letters from Alfred Clayton Cole to Oscar Browning at nationalarchives.gov.uk, accessed 28 February 2019 He had an older brother, William Utting Cole (1851–1892), who became an officer in the 3rd Dragoon Guards and died of cholera while serving in India. His widow married secondly Herbert Studd.Martyn Downer, The Sultan of Zanzibar (London: Black Spring Press, 2011,  ), p. 9 He also had one sister, Annie Frances Cole, who in 1876 married Colonel Sir Howard Elphinstone VC, later promoted to general, and they had four daughters.Sidney Lee, ed., "Elphinstone, Howard Crawfurd" in Dictionary of National Biography 1901 supplement (London: Smith, Elder & Co., 1901)
